Bathroom products containing textile must comply with JYSK 4004.

The supplier must send a reference sample to JYSK HO (‘Attn:’ to Purchasing Assistant - PAS) within the deadline stated by CAM and await approval from JYSK before initiating first production.

Suppliers must send photo samples in accordance with Table 1 to JYSK HO (‘Attn:’ to PAS) within the deadline stated by PAS.

Samples must be sent as soon as possible after reference samples are approved by JYSK.

| Washing gloves         | 6   | Unnamed: 2                                                                                                                                                     |
|:-----------------------|:----|:---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------|
| Face cloths            | 6   | nan                                                                                                                                                            |
| Children velour towels | 1   | nan                                                                                                                                                            |
| nan                    | 4   | nan                                                                                                                                                            |
| Towels                 | 4+2 | The size for photo samples must be: 4x 50x100 + 2x 70+140 cm. or 4x 50x90 + 2x 65x135 cm. Samples must include the agreed strap for hanging the towel (see 4). |
| Bath mats              | 2   | Supplier must send specified number of samples for each size.                                                                                                  |
| Bathrobes              | 1   | Size must be S/M.                                                                                                                                              |
| Bathroom equipment     | 3   |

nan                                                                                                                                                            |
| Shower curtains        | 1   | Size must be 150x200 cm                                                                                                                                        |

Suppliers must send space samples in accordance with Table 2 to JYSK HO (‘Attn:’ to PAS):

Space samples must be sent as soon as possible after packaging is approved by JYSK.

| Type of product    |   Number of space samples (Full handling units incl. full packaging) | Comments                                                                                  |
|:-------------------|---------------------------------------------------------------------:|:------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------|
| Towels             |                                                                    2 | Supplier must send handling units in size “50x90 or 50x100 cm” and “65x130 or 70x140 cm”. |
| Bath mats          |                                                                    2 | Supplier must send handling units in all sizes except size 70x120 cm.                     |
| Bathroom equipment |                                                                    2 | -                                                                                         |
| Shower curtains    |                                                                    1 | Supplier must send handling units in all sizes.                                           |
| Bathrobes          |                                                                    1 | Please send one handling unit pr. size and color                                          |

Note: Space samples must be from production with full artwork/packaging (carelabel, u-card/bellyband).

The supplier must send a shipment sample to JYSK HO (‘Attn:’ to PAS) within the deadline stated by PAS and await approval from JYSK before shipping first-order.

Note: If a shipment sample is approved it may be

regarded as and saved as the new reference sample.

For packaging materials used in sales-unit packaging, suppliers must send a material sample with a matching technical specification to PAS and await approval before first use.

After a tender we will need to receive pre-producing samples for your winning program(s). The samples are for

Together with the series name, size, supplier name and date, please also write the complete construction (warp, weft and pile) on the samples, ex.

• Yarn construction warp, count 10/1 RS

• Yarn construction weft, count 12/1 RS

• Yarn construction pile, count 12/1 RS combed

Please send samples so we have all colors and sizes represented.

After approved pre-samples please send space samples showed in Table 3:

| 0         | 1                                                 |
|:----------|:--------------------------------------------------|
| Towels    | Handling unit in the size 50x90 or 50x100 cm      |
| Towels    | Handling unit in the size 65x130 or 70x140 cm     |
| Bathmats  | Handling units in all sizes except size 70x120 cm |
| Bathrobes | Please send one handling unit pr. size and color  |

Note: Space samples are taken from the production with full artwork and packing (carelabel, u-card/bellyband).

Please send one piece of shipment sample of all colors and sizes in the series. Note: If a shipment sample is approved it will be saved as the new master sample. Notes:

For KARLSTAD and NORA:

• Please send all colors in size

50x100 and one color in all sizes (size set).

• Please note that you will need approval from JYSK before shipping the first order.

Please pay close attention to the shared timeline for important deadlines.

After a tender we will need to receive pre-producing samples for your winning program(s). The samples are for approval of both quality, color and size.

Together with the series name, size, supplier name and date, please also write the construction on the samples. Please see ex.

• 150D/288F

Please send so we have all the colors and sizes represented.

After approved pre-samples please send space samples showed in Table 4:

| Type of product      |   Space samples | (Full handling units incl. full packaging)       |
|:---------------------|----------------:|:-------------------------------------------------|
| Microfiber bathrobes |             nan | Please send one handling unit pr. size and color |

Note: Space samples are taken from the production with full artwork and packing (carelabel/bellyband).

Please send one piece of shipment sample in all colors and sizes for the series.

Please note that you will need approval from JYSK before shipping the first order.

Note: If a shipment sample is approved it will be saved as the new master sample.

Please pay close attention to the shared timeline for important deadline dates.

After a tender we will need to receive pre-producing samples for your winning serie(s). The samples are for approval of both quality, color and size.

Please send so we have all colors represented if the article comes in more than one color.

After approved pre-samples please send the following space samples in Table 5:

| Type of product   |   Space samples | Comments (Full handling units incl. full packaging)             |
|:------------------|----------------:|:----------------------------------------------------------------|
| Accessories       |             nan | The supplier must send 2 handling units for each article number |

Note: Space samples are taken from the production with full artwork and packing (hangtag, pamphlet). Please note that you will need approval from JYSK before shipping the first order.

Note: Please note that we do not need a shipment sample. When the space samples are approved, we will take one item from the handling unit and use it as the new master.

Please pay close attention to the shared timeline for important deadline dates.

Care labels must comply with JYSK 6004.

Care label placement and material must comply with Table 6.

| Product type       | Placement                                                                                                                                    | Unnamed: 2      | Material                                                                     |
|:-------------------|:---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------|:----------------|:-----------------------------------------------------------------------------|
| Face cloths Towels | The care label must be placed in the seam in the top right side of the towel.                                                                | nan             | BASIC and PLUS: T

affeta GOLD: TYVEK =55 g/m? According to agreement with CAM |
| Bath mats          | Care label must be placed on the reverse side (bottom) of the Note: Preferable sewn into a seam.                                             | bath mat.       | BASIC and PLUS: Taffeta GOLD: TYVEK =55 g/m? According to agreement with CAM |
| Bath mats          | a On square bath mats the care label must be placed on the long the left short side. Note: Left seen from the front side.                    | side 10 cm from | BASIC and PLUS: Taffeta GOLD: TYVEK =55 g/m? According to agreement with CAM |
| Shower curtains    | Care label must be placed at the top to the right on the reverse shower curtain. Note: Right seen from the front side of the shower curtain. | side of the     | BASIC and PLUS: Taffeta GOLD: TYVEK =55 g/m? According to agreement with CAM |
| Bath robes         | Care label must be placed in left side seam 30 cm from the                                                                                   | bottom.         | BASIC and PLUS: Taffeta GOLD: TYVEK =55 g/m? According to agreement with CAM |
| Other              | According to agreement                                                                                                                       | with CAM        | nan                                                                          |

Page 7/30

Products must be packaged to comply with requirements of JYSK 6001 and JYSK 6101.

When the solution is available, the layout for sales unit packaging is created by JYSK using IDG and forwarded to the supplier.

Note: IDG is currently available for the following products:

• Towels

(Note: Not children velour towels - See 4.2)

• Bath mats

• Bath robes

• Shower curtains

• Accessories

• Care labels

When IDG is not available, suppliers must create the artwork layout in accordance with JYSK 6201. Note: Except children velour towels – See 4.2.

The supplier must proofread the artwork, validate the layout and ensure that all stated information is correct – E.g.: Material description/composition, care symbols, OEKO-TEX logo, barcode, batch number, supplier number and product number.

For new artwork supplier must send proofread and validated artwork to PAS via email and await approval before first

Note: JYSK does not proofread or approve the artwork – The review procedure of new artwork is however in place out of common interest of ensuring the artwork is correct.

Page 8/30

‘EA’ measures are the same as ‘store shelf dimensions’ in the PIF. The ‘store shelf dimension(EA)’ is a unit measure of a single article. If changes in the measurements of an article, CAM must be informed.

Articles in sales display(SDP) must comply with JYSK 6002 and any specific article requirements. For articles in SDP both the SDP measure and the EA measure must be stated in the PIF. The SDP measure must include both the article and the SDP, meaning if the article is higher than the display it must be the total height.

It is important to know how the article should be displayed e.g. upright, laying down, etc.

The following measurements must be stated in the PIF:

• Height: the height of the article

• Width: the width of the article (the side facing front)

• Depth: the depth of the article and refers to the shelf depth and means the article dimension with face forward

Note: Depth = length

Some bowls, trays, baskets or products that can be stacked will have a nesting value as these can be stacked on top of each other.

Nesting measures can’t be entered into SAP, so please send an E-mail with the nesting measure to CAM.

A nesting measure is how much the second bowl/tray/etc. extends above the first when several products are stacked on top of each other.

Page 9/30

Examples of measurements of different products and shapes.

Note: The examples are only to provide an understanding of how to measure different articles and shapes, and not a full guide to all types of articles.

Hanging towels:

Hanging bath mats

Note: For round items, width and depth/length must be the same. Measures must be taken at the widest point. For articles with header cards, the height must be measured from the bottom of the article to the inside of the Euro Lock Hole.

Page 10/30

Edition 16 – 2025-05 Compliancequality@JYSK.com

If not otherwise agreed with CAM the number of Sales units per Handling unit and handling unit format must be in accordance with Table 8.

For products that are packed as handling unit in cardboard boxes:

• Suppliers must size cardboard boxes to fit the sales units without additional air in the box.

• Folded sales unit must be orientated with the facing upwards within the handling unit.

Note: This orientation ensures that the products lie flat and minimizes the risk of deformed sales units.

• Sales units that do not include a plastic bag or cardboard box itself must be packed together in the handling unit cardboard box in one plastic bag.

• The cardboard of the cardboard box must be JYSK CB60 or higher according to JYSK 6001.

For products that are packed in sales display (SDP):

• SDP and fixing of products inside the SDP must comply with JYSK 6002 and be approved by CAM.

• The number of sales units / SDP must be agreed with CAM.

• A sample of the SDP with articles in must be sent to and approved by CAM before first shipment.

• The size of the SDP must be:

• Height: 4 cm

• Width: maximum 26 cm, adjusted to the article

• Depth: maximum 19 cm, adjusted to the article

Edition 16 – 2025-05 Compliancequality@JYSK.com

Towels must include minimum one strap in quality and placement(s) according to agreement with CAM.

Page 12/30

Towels must be folded according to the instructions listed in Table 9.

• For towels in unmentioned sizes the supplier must clarify the folding method with CAM.

PLUS and GOLD (KRONBORG) towels must be labelled with a clamp paper label in accordance with JYSK 6001 and

The clamp must be pinned to the towel with two tag-pins only piercing one layer of the towel. Note: BASIC towels should contain only the care label.

Page 17/30

Children velour towels must include a strap in the center of the upper short side of the towel in quality according to agreement with CAM.

Children velour towels must be packaged as sales units on a hanger with a header card.

• The supplier must create the layout for the header card in accordance with JYSK 6001.

• The supplier must fold children velour towels in a way that ensures the motive will be presented in the best possible way. The folding method must be uniform within and between orders.

Children velour towels must be folded to the following sizes:

• Width: 25 cm

• Length: 3 cm

• Height: 32 cm (37 cm including hanger)

Bath mats must be folded according to 5.2 and either be:

• Labelled with a clamp according to 5.1.1

• Attached to a hanger with header card according to 5.1.2

If not informed the supplier must contact PAS to clarify the packaging method.

Folded PLUS and GOLD (KRONBORG) bath mats must be labelled with a clamp paper label in accordance with JYSK

6001 and JYSK 6201.

Note: BASIC bath mats should contain only the care label.

The clamp must be pinned to the bath mat with two tag-pins piercing the bath mat as few times as possible. Note: One time for square bath mats and two times for round bath mats.

The folded bath mat must be attached to a hanger and header card in accordance with JYSK 6001 and JYSK 6201. The hanger and header card must be attached with at least two tag-pins.

The hanger must be centered with the product to ensure that it will hang vertically in the stores.

The hook must have the opening facing to the left when seen from the front-facing of the sales unit.

Page 20/30

• Ø 50 cm.

• Ø 60 cm.

• Ø 70 cm.

• 50 x 80 cm (Folded and on hanger)

• 60 x 85 cm

Shower curtains must be folded and attached to a hanger and header card in accordance with JYSK 6001 and JYSK 6201.

The hanger alignment must ensure that the product will hang vertically in the stores.

The hook must have the opening facing to the left when seen from the front-facing of the sales unit.

The sales unit must have a size of W17 x H35 cm (Width x Height).

Note: The thickness of the sales unit is given by the properties of the folded product.

Bathrobes must be folded around a cardboard stiffener to have a facing of W26,5 x H37 cm (Width x Height). Note: The thickness of the sales unit is given by the properties of the folded product.

• The bathrobe must be folded in a way that ensures a uniform thickness of the sales unit.

• The folding method must be consistent within and between orders.

• The bathrobe must be fixed to the stiffener in the top.

The folded bathrobe must be enclosed by a paper bellyband in accordance with JYSK 6001 and JYSK 6201.

The bellyband front must be centered on the facing of the folded bathrobe.

The closing method of the bellyband must be double-sided adhesive tape and strengthened with a transparent round sticker.

• The adhesive tape must not adhere to the product itself.

• The sticker must be neatly placed (centered) on the bellyband closing edge.

Footwear must be labelled in accordance with Directive 94/11/EC using either pictograms or written indications to indicate the material and the shoe part it corresponds to, see 8.1.1 and 8.1.2.

Note: Fiber composition labelling is not mandatory for textile parts of footwear according to Regulation (EU) 1007/2011.

The part of the footwear which the material type corresponds to must be indicated.

Lining and sock

structural element which is

attached to the outersole.

The bottom part of the footwear article, which is subjected to abrasive wear and attached to the

3 General packaging requirements
Products must be packaged to comply with requirements of JYSK 6001 and JYSK 6101.
3.1 Procedures for artwork
When the solution is available, the layout for sales unit packaging is created by JYSK using IDG and forwarded to the supplier.
Note: IDG is currently available for the following products:
(Note: Not children velour towels - See 4.2)
When IDG is not available, suppliers must create the artwork layout in accordance with JYSK 6201. Note: Except children velour towels – See 4.2.

The supplier must proofread the artwork, validate the layout and ensure that all stated information is correct – E.g.: Material description/composition, care symbols, OEKO-TEX logo, barcode, batch number, supplier number and product number.
For new artwork supplier must send proofread and validated artwork to PAS via email and await approval before first
Note: JYSK does not proofread or approve the artwork – The review procedure of new artwork is however in place out of common interest of ensuring the artwork is correct.
Edition 16 – 2025-05 Compliancequality@JYSK.com
3.2 Store shelf dimensions (EA)

‘EA’ measures are the same as ‘store shelf dimensions’ in the PIF. The ‘store shelf dimension(EA)’ is a unit measure of a single article. If changes in the measurements of an article, CAM must be informed.

Articles in sales display(SDP) must comply with JYSK 6002 and any specific article requirements. For articles in SDP both the SDP measure and the EA measure must be stated in the PIF. The SDP measure must include both the article and the SDP, meaning if the article is higher than the display it must be the total height.
It is important to know how the article should be displayed e.g. upright, laying down, etc.
The following measurements must be stated in the PIF:
• Height: the height of the article
• Width: the width of the article (the side facing front)
• Depth: the depth of the article and refers to the shelf depth and means the article dimension with face forward
Note: Depth = length
Some bowls, trays, baskets or products that can be stacked will have a nesting value as these can be stacked on top of each other.
Nesting measures can’t be entered into SAP, so please send an E-mail with the nesting measure to CAM.
A nesting measure is how much the second bowl/tray/etc. extends above the first when several products are stacked on top of each other.
Figure 1 Example of nesting measurement
Edition 16 – 2025-05 Compliancequality@JYSK.com

3.3 Packing of handling units
If not otherwise agreed with CAM the number of Sales units per Handling unit and handling unit format must be in accordance with Table 8.

Product type Sales units / Handling unit Handling unit format • Washing gloves • Face cloths 24 Plastic bags in Masterbox L114 x W76 x H100 cm s l e w o • Guest towels • Towels 12 T • Bath towels 6 • Bath sheets 3 Cardboard box • Shower curtains According to agreement with CAM • Bath mats • Bath robes According to agreement with CAM • Bathroom equipment According to agreement with CAM and other Note: Smaller items are normally packaged in sales displays according to JYSK 6002
Table 8 – Number of sales units / Handling unit
For products that are packed as handling unit in cardboard boxes:
• Suppliers must size cardboard boxes to fit the sales units without additional air in the box.
• Folded sales unit must be orientated with the facing upwards within the handling unit.
Note: This orientation ensures that the products lie flat and minimizes the risk of deformed sales units.
• Sales units that do not include a plastic bag or cardboard box itself must be packed together in the handling unit cardboard box in one plastic bag.
• The cardboard of the cardboard box must be JYSK CB60 or higher according to JYSK 6001.
For products that are packed in sales display (SDP):
• SDP and fixing of products inside the SDP must comply with JYSK 6002 and be approved by CAM.
• The number of sales units / SDP must be agreed with CAM.
• A sample of the SDP with articles in must be sent to and approved by CAM before first shipment.
• The size of the SDP must be:
• Height: 4 cm
• Width: maximum 26 cm, adjusted to the article
• Depth: maximum 19 cm, adjusted to the article
